column8: text

http://www.thesundaily.my/news/2207106All parties are equal in Pakatan Harapan27 March 2017 Aiezat FadzellKUALA LUMPUR: The concept of equal power sharing in Pakatan Harapan is the coalition's best traits, said DAP National Organising Secretary Anthony Loke.Loke (DAP-Seremban) said this is what differentiates the opposition front from the ruling coalition Barisan Nasional (BN) which is predominantly led by Umno."No big brother or small brother in Pakatan Harapan, we are a coalition where its components are equally strong."There are no dominant parties, and that is what differentiates Pakatan Harapan and Barisan Nasional. The people don't want another Umno in Pakatan Harapan," Loke said during a press conference held at Parliament's media centre here.He was commenting on Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) President Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin's suggestion for a dominant Malay party to lead Pakatan Harapan.Loke however said DAP will discuss the matter with PKR, Amanah and PPBM in the coalition's first meeting after PPBM officially joined the pact last Monday."All component parties are equal, where every idea will be discussed but not all will be accepted."We are open to suggestions. We are prepared to talk and discuss any suggestions by PPBM. But of course (we) will have our argument(s); not all suggestions by PPBM will be accepted," he said.

Need to amend constitution and set to 4-5 Prime Minister (depends on how many parties in that coalition)... So, before amending constitution, need to form government with current constitution... Hence, 1 Prime Minister...

You could have also used the Swiss Federation example.  They are not communist in anyway.  But noo.......   Aiyah.  It won't be perfect lah.  But what this Loke chap said is pretty close to it.  PH is made up of more or less equals.  Like PR before.  If there was one big dominant party in PR, the selection of the new MB for Selangor wouldn't have been so messy.  PKR wanted a new one.  PAS didn't agree.  DAP caught unaware but later went along with PKR.  If there was a dominant party in PR, that wouldn't have happened.  PSThat actually sounds like a coalition of equal powers, not coalition of equals.

Yeah, I know.  But others might not see it as minorities vs Malay-Bumi majority.  Maybe one day when everyone sees each other as Malaysians first.  But that's not going to happen in most of /k people's life times.  That's kind of sad.  Nevermind.  Go bask in your majority political power.
Nah....just citing an example of an alternative government structure.  We should uphold our constitution anyway.

Theoretically that can be done with rotational leadership. Top pengerusi become the prime minister if they win. So no way they would be able to register pakatan properly as one entity. The only way is to make it compulsory for either one of amanah, ppbm and pkr to rotate the leadership. Dap would never hold the pengerusi seat. So if it goes that way, no such thing as equality anymore. Again its BN 2.0.They all know that and thats why there is no black and white for pakatan. I read here and there. Yes, all that was agreed.  But it hasn't been decided what would the new name be.  Muhyiddin proposed Barisan Rakyat only yesterday.  It was a proposal.  Lim Guan Eng said he would consult other partners before giving an opinion.  He didn't reject it outright.  Those two articles, one by Stephen Ng and the other by Timmy Say; they appear to be writers or contributors to MalaysiaKini and Free Malaysiatoday respectively.  Are they opposition supporters, highly likely.  But are they card carrying members, I don't know.  It is the parties that get to decide.  Most of us are just supporters, by the sidelines.  So, I think you might have missed something.
Lets get PH or whatever they call themselves to Putrajaya and see if it becomes an Animal Farm.
this. Like it or not, 1 party has to be the leader.This is why in the end, people will still vote for bn. haishhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

Actually, ah Loke was just saying it is a coalition of equals lah.  There might be a leader but if everything is done in a consultative and consensus way amongst all parties, that's very good already.  But even with Anwar Ibrahim as big boss, we can see he some times go off on his own way, disastrously.  Not just for him but the whole coalition.
Ha, you should just read your own posts.. you're not even sure what they call themselves now, or even if an alliance still exists, and you want to vote them in?

But I do read my own posts.  I emphasize on substance over form.  Whatever they call themselves is just a name, i.e. a form.  What matters to me more is substance.  BN has a long and well established name.  But it has also brought us PKFZ, NFC, 1MDB and many more.  So much for form.  But you want to place more importance on that, go ahead.
